subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one.
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0100_01C861D2.E979D000
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I always wonder what spirits are doing hanging around cemeteries anyway.  Y=
ou'd think they would gravitate somewhere more meaningful than where their =
body was deposited, wouldn't you?  I haven't had much luck picking up grave=
yard EVP personally, but I do have one cool one.  I was standing at the doo=
r of a mausoleum where a former governor and his wife are entombed, and I c=
alled the wife's name out loud while recording.  The response is "Hannah is=
n't here!"  

Robin


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Lisby<mailto:=
lisby@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com> 
  Sent: Monday, January 28, 2008 4:57 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 File posted. Weird one.


  They might. From what I have heard of other pe=
ople's cemetery EVPs, it sounds like a lot of cemeteries are populated with=
 people who haven't made it over. I find cemetery EVP to be the most fascin=
ating because they seem to offer a glimpse into a chaotic and not-so-pretty=
 part of the After Life that very few are willing to look at. Our cemeterie=
s seem to me to truly be cities of the dead. 



  Ann


  On Jan 28, 2008,=
 at 4:07 AM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:




    I hear it all!  I'm envious=
 of your location and all the activity you're picking up.  Do you think som=
e of these souls need help crossing over?

    Robin


      ----- Original=
 Message -----
      From: lisbyfarrum<mailto:lisby@...>
      To=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
      Sent: Sunda=
y, January 27, 2008 5:19 PM
      Subject: [EVP-ITC] File posted. Weird one=
.


      Gimme some opinions on this one, gang. The first part of the clip=
 is
      the speed it can through at. The repeat is slowed by about 70 per=
cent.
      I hear it as "Estep." I thought I had heard the word yes, so I =
ask,
      "Yes?" Under my voice is the name "Andrew," then "I'm Stu." "Per=
fect."
      "No..??...asshole...fucking scared."

      Do you hear this a=
s I do? I'm postulating right now that because I
      live immediately acr=
oss the street from a cemetery, and in a
      100-year-old sitting atop a =
200+-year-old foundation and cellar, that
      perhaps local dead folk who=
 haven't crossed are popping in during
      sessions. The voice that said =
"fucking scared" I swear I heard in
      another file in my folder saying =
"scared people."

      Ann
